title: Experimental study on the mechanical and electrochemical properties of aqueous emulsifiable diphenylmethane diisocyanate-modified silicon–carbon composite electrodes
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,19903-19911
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA03289F, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Dongliang Liu, Detao Kong, Qinghua Yang, Yaolong He, Hongjiu Hu
Aqueous emulsifiable diphenylmethane diisocyanate (EMDI) can form strong chemical bonds with aqueous adhesives due to the large number of isocyanate (–NCO) groups, which can enhance the mechanical performance of the adhesives.
